title: Kenya: Civil servants set for July salary increment
text:
Your are here » Home » Kenya Civil servants set for July salary increment By Joseph Muchiri | Updated Tue, February 14th 2017 at 10:12 GMT +3 SHARE THIS ARTICLE Share on Twitter Public Service, Youth and Gender Affairs Cabinet Secretary Sicily Kariuki. (Photo: Joseph Muchiri/Standard) 
More than 600,000 civil servants are set to enjoy a salary increase from July. This comes as the Public Service ministry said it would sign a collective bargaining agreement with the Union of Kenya Civil Servants as a commitment to implement harmonised public service salaries recommended by the Salaries and Remuneration Commission (SRC). 
Under the new structure, the lowest-paid worker will earn Sh14,442 and the highest Sh292,765 per month. WATCH THIS
